info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Litchfield and south central Berkshire Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 741 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Litchfield, or 9 miles southwest of Torrington, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Norfolk, Litchfield, Canaan, Sandisfield, Northwest Harwinton, New Preston, Winsted, Ashley Falls, Harwinton, Goshen, Morris, New Marlborough, Colebrook, Warren, Cornwall, Bantam, South Norfolk, West Torrington and Sodom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
